intro: Cymburus, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Aizoaceae. These plants are typically found in arid and coastal environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. They are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, often colorful flowers that bloom in the evening. Cymburus species are known for their ability to store water, making them well adapted to drought conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
